page.title: 01BOOTHBY PAGNELL GENERAL VIEW
page.content: A SMALL RURAL VILLAGE SEVEN MILES SOUTH-EAST OF GRANTHAM ON THE GENTLY UNDULATING LIMESTONE OF THE KESTEVEN PLATEAU. IT IS MAINLY A DORMITORY VILLAGE FOR THE TOWNS OF GRANTHAM AND STAMFORD NOW THAT AGRICULTURE IS THE ONLY OCCUPATION IN THE IMMEDIATE AREA. MIXED FARMING IS FOUND CLOSE TO THE VILLAGE BUT CEREALS PREDOMINATE IN THE BLOCK AS A WHOLE. SCATTERED SMALL WOODLAND AREAS ARE ANOTHER FEATURE OF THE BLOCK. THE SMALL NORMAN MANOR HOUSE IS THE BEST EXAMPLE IN THE COUNTRY AND IS THE MOST IMPORTANT HISTORICAL FEATURE. THE MANY DIFFERENT AGES OF THE HOUSES FROM TUDOR TO TWENTIETH CENTURY REFLECT A QUIET VILLAGE THAT HAS ADAPTED AND CONTINUED FROM DOMESDAY,1086,TO DOMESDAY,1986.
